info.question: Which of the following RAID types are striped with no redundancy, and have good performance?
Which of the following RAID types are mirrored and redundant?
Which of the following RAID types are good for reads, bad for writes, AWS does not recommend ever putting this type of RAID on EBS volumes?
Which of the following RAID types are striped and mirrored, have good redundancy, and good performance?
How do you get even better performance from EBS volumes?
answers: attach multiple EBS volumes to your EC2 instance, then configure them as a RAID array
attach more EBS volumes to your EC2 instance
attach larger EBS volumes to your EC2 instance
attach more, smaller EBS volumes to your EC2 instance
correctAnswer: attach multiple EBS volumes to your EC2 instance, then configure them as a RAID array

info.question: If you have an EC2 instance running a Casandra database on your attached EBS volume, where your performance is suffering because of disk I/O, how do you improve the performance?
answers: attach multiple EBS volumes to your EC2 instance, then configure them as a RAID array and run your Casandra database on the RAID array
attach more EBS volumes to your EC2 instance and run the Casandra database across the additional disks
attach larger EBS volumes to your EC2 instance and run the Casandra database across the larger disks
attach more, smaller EBS volumes to your EC2 instance and run the Casandra database across the smaller disks
correctAnswer: attach multiple EBS volumes to your EC2 instance, then configure them as a RAID array and run your Casandra database on the RAID array

info.question: Which of these methods can you use to create a snapshot from a RAID array?
answers: take an application consistent snapshot by freezing the file system, then unmounting the RAID array, then take a snapshot
take an application consistent snapshot by shutting down the EC2 instance, then take a snapshot, then restart the EC2 instance
take an application consistent snapshot by terminating the EC2 instance, then taking a snapshot of the RAID array, then recreate the EC2 instance
take an application consistent snapshot by taking a snapshot of the RAID array while the EC2 instance is running
correctAnswer: take an application consistent snapshot by freezing the file system, then unmounting the RAID array, then take a snapshot
take an application consistent snapshot by shutting down the EC2 instance, then take a snapshot, then restart the EC2 instance
